reviews.text: As a family of 2 adults and 4 children we requested interconnecting rooms, which we received with no problems. At reception the man was very helpful. When we got to the rooms the children received a free mickey mouse soft toy each, which was a lovely surprise.
reviews.title: Good but needs Updating

reviews.text: The interconnecting room worked really well. Our room had a few problems, one of the lights wasn't working, the audio dial in the bathroom did not work, the paintwork was badly chipped, there were some nails protruding from the woodwork. The wall paper was also ripped and quite marked in places.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: The children's room was much better, everything was working and they even had a bigger wardrobe than us! The water glasses in both rooms were not cleaned during the entire stay but other than that the rooms were very clean.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: We also had a travel cot set up in the room when we arrived, which we had not requested, so we had to ask for it to be taken away, at which point they bought us a second cot! Just a language barrier problem I think. Anyway, it was all sorted out quite quickly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The breakfast was really good, plenty of choice, hot and cold food. Although the location of breakfast seems to change on daily basis.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay

reviews.text: the new york hotel what can i say but wow. my daughters 19 and 21 were so impressed. as you enter the lobby the gorgeous smell,the fabulous theming and the welcoming and polite staff. check in was efficient and fast. no hassle and they knew what they had to do and delivered.
reviews.title: i adore this hotel

reviews.text: concierege polite and helpfull there was nothing they could not answer. very good service.
reviews.title: Met expectations!!

reviews.text: the lift plays jazz music a really nice touch. and is all themed down to the lift buttons. loved using the lifts
reviews.title: Tired and not quite the same.........

reviews.text: room was large enough,very warm,clean and welcoming. celebrating a birthday welcomed with a minnie mouse toy and ballons. bottles of water and glasses etc.the cabinet holding the tv and mini bar beautiful art deco wood. but tv was not working but was not in the room long enough to care tbh.beautiful lamps,framed pictures,heavy curtains,beautiful high quality cotton sheets. crisp and very clean. very bouncy quality pillows. synthetic quilt but i suppose some people have allergies. bed very very firm but got used to it and had a good nights sleep. we had a standard room 1168 with a garden view poor views but hey lol. good for the lift as not too far to walk and not too near so you get disturbed. very little noise from other rooms a good plus. you have a table with chairs and loads of storage huge amounts. nice deep drawers. and ample hanging space and shelves very generous. we requested a cot and it was there. a travel cot for a baby nearly three and it was ample big. there was also enough room for our large buggy in the room. phone houskeeping if you want a kettle. they are very prompt and sooooo curteous. lovely lovely staff
reviews.title: In need of a revamp
Enjoyable stay
reviews.text: toiletries in bathroom,shampoo,shower gel and bars of soap which i prefer to liquid soap. bathroom are art deco style including the shower head. art deco taps and towel rails. two basins a good plus but no non slip mat. you can bath rather than shower if you like. lots of towels good quality ones. and flannels.

We stayed here with family and friends over New Year 2008. We booked suites so had large rooms with separate bedrooms which was great for us because the kids had a separate room. Rooms were well laid out with a reasonable amount of space but were quite dark, you needed lights on even in the day. Beds were comfy. Hotel location is very good, just a short walk to the parks.
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel......

likes.liked: — New York Club Lounge, although only available select few

reviews.text: We had use of the New York Club Lounge which was great, free tea/coffee during the day, cakes mid afternoon and a character breakfast everyday. Breakfast was very good, reasonable choice and very relaxed.
reviews.title: Great time had by all

likes.liked: — Close to park at an affordable price
likes.disliked: — Carpets in corridor to bedrooms showing their age

reviews.text: For the amount of money we paid, it was very expensive and not really worth it. We experienced the usual rudeness in the theme parks (!) with staff not really being very courteous nor bothering about giving us a good time. In fact one staff member said, when I compained to her about her attitude toward me, to speak to her Manager, she wasn't bothered because I would go home after today, she would be there tomorrow *with a shrug of her shoulders*.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and a wonderful Holiday

likes.disliked: — Shop was a little small thats it!!

reviews.text: Would I go again..... probably not. For the same cost, we could have had a week in Florida with people being nice to us!!!!
reviews.title: Magical xmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 2nd visit to DLRP. We were a group of 8 ad and 4 children and stayed at Hotel New York. We had a fabulous time. The hotel was lovely as were the staff. Was the hotel without fault? no, did our kids think it was? yes and that's all that counts. It also has a great location at the edge of Disney Village so no long trek for dining.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a stay here very convenient location with large room. Others have mentioned there hare no tea facilities but we asked for a kettle and cups which were delivered within minutes we had taken our own coffee to use .Breakfast was good with 3 locations best being Manhattan as it is smaller and more cosy than the other rooms which are a bit like a cafeteria .disney characters visit but queue can be long.It is a short walk to parks and no shuttle bus is required great after watching final display when thousands leave the park.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We stayed in the New York Disney hotel three days this week and I found it very good to a point.
reviews.title: Great location
Enjoyable stay at the New York
reviews.text: It's in a great location only 30 seconds walk to Disney village , breakfast was great and the kids got to met a Disney character each morning before and after breakfast.
But there is nothing for the kids to do in the hotel no films no play area nothing.
reviews.title: Fantastic location BUT...

reviews.text: Still had a great stay, hotel was great and would stay again no problem.
reviews.title: Absolutely fab , will defo be going staying again

reviews.text: We arrived by rail from England,at the rail station we were directed to the yellow bus 2 minutes walk away. This took us to the hotel(can walk in 10 mins.) .Check in was perfect, our room had a king size bed and quite "roomy".We had asked to be next to our grandchildren who were put in the adjoining room with their parents --great stuff! Breakfast was great,swimming pool excellent,the bar was good with super snacks,no faults really.Ideal location just by Disney village and the main parks-would stay again!
reviews.title: magic

reviews.text: We have just returned from here with our 4 year old daughter. We enjoyed every bit of Disneyland, very magical especially the parades which really makes it an enjoyable experience. The hotel was nice, swimming pool very good, we booked on a B&B basis, plenty of selection at breakfast. We also had a buffet dinner here in Parkside Diner, again plenty of choice only thing that bothered us was our 4 year old was charged €15 euro (set menu charge for kids 3yrs +) and she only had a little pasta, apparently that's the way it is, from looking at other restaurants it would appear to be same, so if you are aware in advance it's not a surprise, which I guess we were before we booked. Rooms were clean, nice & spacious, toiletries provided. Location of hotel was excellent, very short walk to Disney Village.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night stay with partner and 5 year old son and I can honestly say this was best hotel ever. It was our first trip to Disneyland and staying here was our best decision. Stay very helpful and friendly and facilities amazing. Was hard to get son out of pool and games room. Breakfast was lovely and plenty to go around. Overall we would recommend this hotel for convienence, cleanliness, quality and overall a great time. Meeting Mickey and Minnie as soon as we got out the lift started off our stay just as we had hoped for!!!
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay!!!

reviews.text: Very colse to both parks and the village, warm and helpful staff, great breakfast. Rooms need to freshen up a bit (for example duvets would be better than current bed covers - a bit dusty for my taste). Overall a good choice
reviews.title: Very convenient for a family stay at Disneyland Paris

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 children aged 2 and 4. We had two double beds in one room, and actually it worked fine. Nice large room, we had a patio out to the main path to Disney village which was quite handy.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Went to this Hotel start of March 09.
reviews.title: Go to the States,Simple as that

reviews.text: Itsa reasonable standard slightly worn round the edges, however both it and the park are missing something special -staff who care!.Compared to the U.S parks the sevice is poor, you can have all the characters and sets you want, however if you do not have staff who go that little bit extra,smile, say hello/goodbye without being prompted the sheen comes off and it becomes apparent it is a slick(sometimes) money making machine.
reviews.title: Good location, adequate hotel for time spent in it
good location and standard
reviews.text: Anyway a few tips -
1-Get down for breakfast before 8 or queue (no fun with young kids)
reviews.title: Dont bother, pay the little extra and go to Florida instead!

reviews.text: 2-Take food/snacks in with you or follow the tips on this site for shops (pricey in the park and hotel even if the exchange rate is good)
reviews.title: Empire State Club - Well worth the Extra

reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights here. Good and Bad points. In relation to the room, this is not 4 star for sure, not even a kettle for coffee, though I think you can ask to have one provided. Though I know is it is 'themed' it still looked tired, although it is clean. The room was a disappointment. On the plus side, breakfast was good, didn't really have to queue much and there was plenty of choice. Location is very good, only a short walk to the parks. The 'kiddie ' area is a complete joke though, there is basically nothing there and is pretty pointless, however, lets face it, you will most likely be at the parks all day. Overall, the hotel is OK, but I feel you would do just as well in one of the other hotels that doesn't claim to be 4 star.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: One of the best family holidays ever. Hotel is ideally located for the park - within walking distance. Staff were extremely helpful. Food was excellent at both breakfast and dinner - plenty of food at the buffet. Would definitely recommend it and would use it again.
reviews.title: Fantastic memories

reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at the hotel and generally throughout our Disney experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The hotel was clean, spacious, well staffed by friendly, gracious and extremely helpful people and is ideally located within the Disney complex.
reviews.title: not what i was expecting !!!!

reviews.text: There were no queues for breakfast, lunch etc and the food was plentiful and more than sufficient.
reviews.title: BIG APPLE - big fun!

reviews.text: After several trips to the Disneyland Hotel, this was a budget alternative. The lobby was very disappointing, with dark decor and tacky apples, and none of the grandeur of hotels in the USA. Nevertheless, the hotel rooms were on par with the Disneyland Hotel, accounting for the significant price difference. While there is no character breakfast, the food is of comparable quality, and the Disneyland Hotel breakfast is occassionally underwhelming character-wise anyway, so there is no great loss. The main disney characters still frequent the main lobby and breakfast lobby, so there is always an opportunity for photos.
reviews.title: Excellent alternative to the Disneyland Hotel

reviews.text: Fastpass is a big advantage, but of course the VIP fastpass is not available to New York resdients, yet you still get into the park an hour before other visitors by showing your ticket and hotel pass. New York staff were exceptional. The friendliness in Disneyland Paris seems genuine, and rather more appealing than the 'have a nice day' plastic style that often accompanies US locations, but a flash of a smile gets some staff to go well beyond the call of duty to help you. The staff are also more relaxed and less concerned about rules than you might experience in theme parks in the UK. this is because visitors to park are not stupid. The lake in front of the hotel was frozen, but nobody attempted to walk on it, despite no signs. The French clearly trust the less litigious continental tourist, and so you won't be bound by the stifles of health and safety as you get in blighty.
reviews.title: Very Dangerous Swimming Pool - Beware!!!!

reviews.text: The walk to the parks was a little long for our children, but it is through the exciting Village, so it is certainly not boring. We had a great stay, and as budget allows, is a great alternative to the Disneyland Hotel in all respects.
reviews.title: Magical Stay

reviews.text: I want to warn all parents of the very dangerous swimming pool that there is at this hotel. It is an attractive pool, but there is absolutely nothing to warn you that there IS NO SHALLOW END! The depth of the pool is the same throughout - a very dangerous 5 feet +. My five and a half year old daughter - (who is now at the stage where she can swim without floatation aids in the shallow end) - sank under the water on going down the steps, because we simply did not realise this, and was pulled up very quickly by a neighbour. We had expected this first part of the pool to be shallow, as in a conventional public pool, and instead it is very deep. There were no signs, except for one small sign on the floor, to indicate this. Moreover you cannot see how deep it is from the side, and that there is nowhere for a child - or even an average sized woman, to safely stand. I now know from bitter and terrifying experience what happens when you walk off the bottom step.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems incredible to me that the swimming pool of a hotel in the world's most famous family resort should have such a trecherous pool. Until the management redesign it, or at the very least put up large signs warning of its exceptional depth, then I would not recommend that you stay there, or that if you do, you make sure that your child has floatation aids on at all times - even if they would not normally require floatation aids in a pool in which they were able to stand.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
